task_prompt: Search Baidu Baike for an introduction to RNN (Recurrent Neural Network)
send_prompt:
You're very familiar with the Windows operating system. Now you need to use the Windows operating system to complete a mission.
Your goal now is to manipulate a computer screen, video width: 1024, video height: 768, the overall mission is: "Search Baidu Baike for an introduction to RNN (Recurrent Neural Network)".

We have developed an implementation plan for this overall mission:

    1. Input 'RNN (Recurrent Neural Network)'

    2. Select the appropriate result and click

    3. Browse the current page


The current subtask is "Select the appropriate result and click".
You can use the mouse and keyboard, the optional actions are:
```json
[
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"click","mouse_button":"left","mouse_position":{"width":int,"height":int}},
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"double_click","mouse_button":"left","mouse_position":{"width":int,"height":int}},
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"scroll_up","scroll_repeat":int},
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"scroll_down","scroll_repeat":int},
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"move","mouse_position":{"width":int,"height":int}},
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"drag","mouse_button":"left","mouse_position":{"width":int,"height":int}},
    {"action_type":"KeyboardAction","keyboard_action_type":"press","keyboard_key":"KeyName in keysymdef"},
    {"action_type":"KeyboardAction","keyboard_action_type":"press","keyboard_key":"Ctrl+A"},
    {"action_type":"KeyboardAction","keyboard_action_type":"text","keyboard_text": "Hello, world!"},
    {"action_type":"WaitAction","wait_time":float}
]
```
Where the mouse position is relative to the top-left corner of the screen, and the keyboard keys are described in [keysymdef.h].

Please make output execution actions, please format them in json, e.g. 
My plan is to click the Windows button, it's on the left bottom corner, so my action will be:
```json 
[
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"click","mouse_button":"left","mouse_position":{"width":10,"height":760}}
]
```

Another example: 
My plan is to open the notepad, so my action will be:
```json
[
    {"action_type":"KeyboardAction","keyboard_action_type":"press","keyboard_key":"Super_L"},
    {"action_type":"KeyboardAction","keyboard_text":"notepad"},
    {"action_type":"KeyboardAction","keyboard_action_type":"press","keyboard_key":"Return"}
]
```


The current subtask is "Select the appropriate result and click", please give the detailed next actions based on the state of the existing screen image.
LLM_response:
Based on the current screen image showing the Baidu Baike search results for "RNN (Recurrent Neural Network)," it appears that the relevant search results are present on the screen. To read an introduction to RNN on Baidu Baike, we will proceed by clicking on the search result link.

Assuming that the first search result is the most relevant one, we will click on the title of the first search result entry displayed on the screen. If the link is around the middle of the screen, we can estimate that the coordinates for the link might be around a width of 512 pixels (half of 1024) and a height of 384 pixels (half of 768). However, the exact position can vary, so we'd adjust it based on the monitor's layout and interface elements.

Here's an example of the action in JSON format:
```json
[
    {"action_type":"MouseAction","mouse_action_type":"click","mouse_button":"left","mouse_position":{"width":512,"height":384}}
]
```
Please note that since I cannot interact with the actual user interface elements, the suggested mouse coordinates above are an estimated example and would need to be adjusted to the actual position of the link in the live interface.
